content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please provide the following answer and data requests below.
If your authority does not have manage maintained nursery schools, please disregard the whole request.
1. Provide a list of a head of department contact who manages 'Early Years', the list should include their name and email address.
2. Provide a list of 'Maintained Nursery Schools' operating with a deficit.
3. If any 'Maintained Nursery Schools' have been discussed of possible closure, or ear marked for closure, please list them.
Yours faithfully,
Kyle Smith

Dear Kyle Smith,
Thank you for your request for information relating to early years data
which we received on 28/07/2023.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 25/08/2023. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
From: Kyle <[FOI #1009480 email]>
Sent: Friday, July 28, 2023 8:20 AM
To: FOI <[Sheffield City Council request email]>
Subject: Freedom of Information request - EY Data
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please provide the following answer and data requests below.
If your authority does not have manage maintained nursery schools, please
disregard the whole request.
1. Provide a list of a head of department contact who manages 'Early
Years', the list should include their name and email address.
2. Provide a list of 'Maintained Nursery Schools' operating with a
deficit.
3. If any 'Maintained Nursery Schools' have been discussed of possible
closure, or ear marked for closure, please list them.
Yours faithfully,
Kyle Smith
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Please use this email address for all replies to this request:
[2][FOI #1009480 email]

requests to Sheffield City Council? If so, please contact us using this

For more detailed guidance on safely disclosing information, read the

https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlo...

https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlo...
Please note that in some cases publication of requests and responses will
be delayed.
If you find this service useful as an FOI officer, please ask your web
manager to link to us from your organisation's FOI page.

Dear Kyle Smith,
Thank you for your request for information relating to early years data
which we received on 28/07/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1. The Local Authority does not have a single head of department that
manages Early Years.
There are a number of Portfolio’s within the Council that have
responsibility for Early Years.
a. The Public Health and Integrated Commissioning Portfolio has
responsibility in the following areas:
i.      The
Childcare Planning Team has responsibility for early years place planning
and sufficiency.
ii.      The
Commissioning Early Years Support & Prevention Team also support Family
Hubs.
Director of Children and Families
Sally Williams
[1][
email address
]
b. The Childrens Services Portfolio has responsibility in the following
areas:
i.      The
Business Planning Children & Schools service area, within the Childrens
Services Portfolio, has responsibility for the resourcing strategy for
Early Years.
ii.      The
Education & Skills, School Effectiveness service area, have responsibility
for the Early Years Quality Team.
Director of Education and
Skills
Andrew Jones
[2][
email address
]
2. We have no Maintained Nursery Schools operating with a deficit.
3. We have no Maintained Nursery Schools currently earmarked for closure.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [3]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[4]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [5][Sheffield City Council request email]
From: FOI
Sent: Friday, July 28, 2023 4:01 PM
To: Kyle <[FOI #1009480 email]>
Subject: Re – Freedom of Information Request – Reference – FOI / 896593
Dear Kyle Smith,
Thank you for your request for information relating to early years data

The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you

Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please provide the following answer and data requests below.
If your authority does not have manage maintained nursery schools, please
disregard the whole request.
1. Provide a list of a head of department contact who manages 'Early
Years', the list should include their name and email address.
2. Provide a list of 'Maintained Nursery Schools' operating with a
deficit.
3. If any 'Maintained Nursery Schools' have been discussed of possible
closure, or ear marked for closure, please list them.
Yours faithfully,
Kyle Smith
